FuncDef:
The clock test-source testclk0 signal 1pps output command sets a signal type for the clock test interface.
The undo clock test-source testclk0 signal 1pps output command deletes the configured signal type for the clock test interface.
The clock test-source testclk0 send-delay slot command sets the send-delay compensation value of the clock test interface to 100 ns.
The undo clock test-source testclk0 send-delay slot command deletes the configured send-delay compensation value of the clock test interface to 100 ns.
The default value of send-delay is 0, indicating that the delivered delay value is 0. The default signal value of the clock test interface is 1PPS, indicating that the signal type is 1PPS.
CLIs: clock test-source testclk0 signal 1pps output slot <slot-id>
undo clock test-source testclk0 send-delay <send-delay-value> slot <slot-id>
undo clock test-source testclk0 signal 1pps output slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
The available slot.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Test port.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

1PPS+RS232.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Signal direction.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Offset for send-delay, in ns.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 10000.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the clock test interface is connected to another device or meter, there is a send-delay due to transmission over cables. As a result, the 1PPS performance has a fixed deviation. To resolve this problem, you can run this command to set an offset for send-delay.
This command is valid only when the device has a clock test interface.
